Method Detail

getDistance

double getDistance(int index1,
                   int index2,
                   int k,
                   double[] x1,
                   double[] x2)
Calculates and returns the distance between two objects. Please note that the distance function has to be symmetric and must obey the triangle inequality. distance in k is: d[k+1](o1,o2)^2 = d[k](o1,o2)^2 - (x1[k]-x2[k])^2 .

Parameters:
index1 - index of first object to compute
index2 - index of second object to compute
k - defines the dimension of current fastmap operation
x1 - is needed when k > 0 (see documentation above), all x1[l] with l < k have to be present.
x2 - is needed when k > 0 (see documentation above), all x2[l] with l < k have to be present.
Returns:
the distance as float from [0, infinite)

getMaximumDistance

int getMaximumDistance(int row,
                       int k,
                       double[][] points)
Used for the heuristic for getting the pivots as described in the paper.

Parameters:
row - defines the row where we want to find the maximum
k - defines the dimension of current fastmap operation
points - is needed when k > 0 (see documentation above), all x1[l] with l < k have to be present.
Returns:
the index of the object with maximum distance to the row object.

normalize

void normalize()
Normalizes the matrix for all values to [0,1]
